AvD_ROM.synopsis: Daisy Dream for Act 3: No longer needing to manipulate the player, Daisy is ready to reveal all in this steamy conclusion to a relationship born out of necessity and lies that blossomed into something even more fucked up. Content warning: Nudity, Tentacles, Transracialism, Hallucinations.
AvD_ROM.how_to_trigger: Queue Campnight NIGHT_DaisyAcknowledgementEnd the Day and Go to Bed

AvD_ROM_147.text: They say that home is where a person can be their truest selves, without guile, without pretence.
AvD_ROM_147.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player wakes up in the dream field. Night. The Emperor is sitting next to them, staring into the sky.

AvD_ROM_30.text: You did well to see off the githyanki who had invaded mine.
AvD_ROM_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor turns to face us, player sits up.

AvD_ROM_143.text: And now that you have seen where I come from, you know all there is to know about me. At least all that matters.

AvD_ROM_38.text: The flavours of my favourite fiddlehead soup, should you wish to experience it for yourself.

AvD_ROM_18.text: My beloved confidant and loyal companion, Rascal.

AvD_ROM_82.text: The very first reward I gifted myself on completion of my first adventure.

AvD_ROM_41.text: The garments with which I concealed and later constructed my appearance as the Emperor.

AvD_ROM_67.text: We spoke of my relationship with Duke Belynne Stelmane - a story I have told no one else.

AvD_ROM_167.text: I have no more secrets from you. No need to resort to subterfuge. We are true allies now, working towards a common goal.

AvD_ROM_85.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_85.text: You really don't sound like a mind flayer.

AvD_ROM_215.text: I have learned to adapt my methods to your needs.

AvD_ROM_57.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_57.text: You led an exciting life. Why did you conceal it from me?

AvD_ROM_134.text: By necessity, not design. But I am glad you appreciate the richness of my experience.

AvD_ROM_36.text: Yours has been no less exciting. But even with all your experience, it has not been easy.

AvD_ROM_99.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_99.text: Why did you resort to subterfuge at all?

AvD_ROM_198.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_198.text: You did some pretty bad things. I'm not sure how I feel about being your ally.

AvD_ROM_9.text: You wouldn't even have come this far without me so, as I see it, you don't have a choice.

AvD_ROM_98.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_98.text: You do a great impression of a human. But you're not fooling me.

AvD_ROM_193.text: Your distrust of me will be our undoing. Would it make a difference if I let you read my thoughts?

AvD_ROM_160.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_160.text: You're an expert at mental manipulation. I wouldn't trust anything you show me.

AvD_ROM_34.text: I will take that as a yes.

AvD_ROM_103.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_103.text: It's fine. I just wanted you to know I know your true nature.

AvD_ROM_87.text: You think you know my true nature?

AvD_ROM_186.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_186.text: Please don't show me your thoughts - I've been there and I didn't like it.

AvD_ROM_172.text: Good. Then you understand why I had to do what I did. It was for your own good.

AvD_ROM_64.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_64.text: No need. You're right. We need to trust each other.

AvD_ROM_142.text: I trust you. And I did what I needed to earn your trust too.

AvD_ROM_218.text: The only way we were ever going to get close enough to the brain to destroy it was by working together.

AvD_ROM_203.text: But few would trust a mind flayer, so I did what I had to do to convince you.

AvD_ROM_122.text: I studied you. Your motivations, your actions, your desires. I deduced the best way to align your goals with my own.

AvD_ROM_223.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_223.text: You make it sound like I was some sort of experiment.

AvD_ROM_146.text: Perhaps, at first, I did consider that you were just a problem to be solved. And not an easy one at that. But I persisted.

AvD_ROM_61.text: That you are complex. And full of contradictions. It was no easy task, but I had to persist.

AvD_ROM_40.text: I needed your absolute dedication to the cause.

AvD_ROM_6.text: I anticipated the challenge, and I anticipated your resistance.

AvD_ROM_91.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_91.text: What I didn't anticipate was how exhausting you would be.

AvD_ROM_20.text: You were stubborn, antagonistic. You didn't want to listen.

AvD_ROM_11.text: You even tried to kill me.

AvD_ROM_112.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_112.text: You weren't that easy to work with either.

AvD_ROM_123.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_123.text: I refuse to be controlled by anyone but my own self.

AvD_ROM_94.text: And yet, here you are, exactly as I instructed. That is all I needed.

AvD_ROM_213.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_213.text: Let me get this straight. You're complaining about being stuck with me?

AvD_ROM_37.text: But you made your choices - such is the burden of freedom. And now we must move on.

AvD_ROM_144.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor stands up. Player stands up.

AvD_ROM_25.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_25.text: What I didn't anticipate was how reasonable you would be.

AvD_ROM_155.text: You don't like to be coddled, cajoled. But you responded well to logic, to rational arguments, to cold, hard facts.

AvD_ROM_127.text: You saw straight to the core of what really mattered.

AvD_ROM_69.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_69.text: I could have done with a little more coddling.

AvD_ROM_187.text: I didn't get that impression. And my calculations are never wrong.

AvD_ROM_1.text: What I didn't anticipate was how much I would enjoy your company. Your mind.

AvD_ROM_150.text: Sometimes I felt almost like we were dancing our way towards something deeper...

AvD_ROM_165.text: You know... this might be our last chance to explore the possibility of... a deeper relationship.

AvD_ROM_178.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_178.text: You're trying to flirt with me now?

AvD_ROM_107.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_107.text: *The back of your mind warms with a rush of feeling, the Emperor's feeling - heat, care, arousal.*

AvD_ROM_51.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_51.text: *And in this dream world, the fires that burn inside you wouldn't  hurt a fly, much less a mind flayer.*

AvD_ROM_133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor levitates player and himself into the air with psionic abilities.

AvD_ROM_148.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor leans in towards the player.

AvD_ROM_184.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player leans in towards Emperor's face, as you would to lean in for a kiss.

AvD_ROM_70.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_70.text: *You feel its breath merging into yours, cold, smelling faintly of vanilla and garlic.*

AvD_ROM_68.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_68.text: *Its breathing quickens as you pull in close to its face. Its excitement palpable.*

AvD_ROM_212.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_212.text: *You pause a moment as a thought occurs to you - where is a mind flayer's mouth?*

AvD_ROM_15.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_15.text: Take its tentacle in your hand, invite it in.

AvD_ROM_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaches out and takes the Emperor's tentacle in their hand (equivalent of holding hands). Player leans in towards Emperor, as if for a kiss.

AvD_ROM_162.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_162.text: *Its breathing quickens as you pull in close to its face. Its excitement palpable.*

AvD_ROM_125.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_125.text: *A memory stirs - diagrams in a book you read long ago - a mind flayer's mouth is underneath the tentacles.*

AvD_ROM_135.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_135.text: *A memory stirs - diagrams in a book you read long ago - a mind flayer's mouth is underneath the tentacles.*

AvD_ROM_191.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_191.text: *If this creature is at all similar to an octopus, as it appears to be, its mouth is probably somewhere underneath the tentacles.*

AvD_ROM_60.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_60.text: *If this creature is at all similar to an octopus, as it appears to be, its mouth is probably somewhere underneath the tentacles.*

AvD_ROM_173.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_173.text: Kiss the tentacle and hope that it's an erogenous appendage.

AvD_ROM_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player kisses the tip of the tentacle. The mind flayer closes its eyes and emits a sound. NodeContext: Ambiguous - did he enjoy that or no? (The truth is he did.)

AvD_ROM_159.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor nods, its eyes still closed.

AvD_ROM_80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player kisses the tentacle again. Mind flayer lets out a moan. NodeContext: Erotic, but in a guttural alien way

AvD_ROM_174.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot over Emperor's shoulder of a tentacle gently wrapping around the player's head, and pulling the player in for a kiss. Player is pulled out of shot (implying both mind flayer and player are now lying down having sex.) Fade to black. One last shudder of a tentacle in the air on the way out.

AvD_ROM_211.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_211.text: *Everything you ever dreamt of and more. The single greatest experience of your life.*
AvD_ROM_211.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade in: Player and mind flayer lying down side by side, looking up at the stars, a hint of naked torso visible where the sheet ends.

AvD_ROM_141.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_141.text: *Pleasure upon pleasure as mind and body intertwined. It was hard to tell where thoughts ended and feelings began.*
AvD_ROM_141.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player rolls onto their side to look at the Emperor.

AvD_ROM_207.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_207.text: *You can read the Emperor's expression better now that you've connected on a deeper level. You know it feels the same way.*
AvD_ROM_207.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor rolls into its side to look adoringly at the player (or as close as a mind flayer can get.)

AvD_ROM_181.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_181.text: I'm sorry. I just don't know what I'm doing.

AvD_ROM_24.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_24.text: Could you maybe not make that noise?

AvD_ROM_221.text: I'm sorry - it's a reflex. But I can stop if I do this...

AvD_ROM_185.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_185.text: Perhaps now just isn't the time. That was... awkward.

AvD_ROM_219.text: I understand. Then let us move on to other things.

AvD_ROM_59.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_59.text: Would you mind parting those tentacles?

AvD_ROM_158.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_158.text: This is awkward... I want to kiss you but I have no idea where.

AvD_ROM_78.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_78.text: *You can't tell if the mind flayer is smiling or not. A symptom of your wider problem.*

AvD_ROM_117.text: I can make this easier for you if you like. My other form might be more familiar for you to navigate.

AvD_ROM_217.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind flayer transforms back into Daisy form.

AvD_ROM_7.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Shot over Daisy pulling the player in for a kiss. Player is pulled out of shot (implying both Daisy and player are now lying down having sex.) Fade to black. 

This will have to account for different player sizes and different daisy sizes.

AvD_ROM_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player rolls over onto their side and clocks the mind flayer lying next to them with mild horror.

AvD_ROM_84.text: Sorry. You didn't leave me much energy to spare to maintain appearances.
AvD_ROM_84.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor rolls into its side to look at the player - acknowledges our skeptical look. NodeContext: sheepish, a bit cheeky

AvD_ROM_83.context: CinematicNodeContext: They sit up and see a portal has been open the entire time.

AvD_ROM_26.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_26.text: *It seems the tadpole allowed you to share more than you would have liked with your companions.*
AvD_ROM_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Through it, their companions stand in a row, aghast. They witnessed it all. The player nudges the Emperor off-screen. The Emperor wakes up and sits up. The player looks at the Emperor with a look of 'what on earth is going on?!'

AvD_ROM_114.text: I said I'd protect you from the Absolute, not each other. And I was... distracted.
AvD_ROM_114.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor sits up, waves its hand, and the portal closes. NodeContext: matter of fact

AvD_ROM_93.text: Don't worry. I'll make sure they don't remember a thing.
AvD_ROM_93.context: NodeContext: referencing the fact that the player just saw all their companions looking at them in a post-coital state with the Emperor - delivered in a matter-of-fact way (he's going to wipe their memories)

AvD_ROM_136.text: Come - it is time to get dressed. We have work to do.

AvD_ROM_23.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_23.text: You sure I can't tempt you into another round?

AvD_ROM_169.text: I am tempted. But it will be quite some time before I am - ah - able - to do that again. And time is not on our side.

AvD_ROM_152.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_152.text: Are we not going to talk about what just happened?

AvD_ROM_164.text: We have communed with our minds entire at the deepest level. What else is there to say?

AvD_ROM_110.text: We are bonded now. And it is time to consummate love, with war.

AvD_ROM_195.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gets up and gets dressed.

AvD_ROM_106.text: The elder brain's hivemind has grown to monstrous proportions. And through the Crown's magic, it has complete control over each and every member.

AvD_ROM_3.text: It was intelligent before. But now, with its hivemind established across the city, it is well on its way to becoming indestructible.

AvD_ROM_111.text: You know now of your Father's plans to use the elder brain to slaughter the world over. One need not read minds to foresee the horrors he will pen with your hand if you do not stand against him.

AvD_ROM_220.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_220.text: You should reconsider your attachment to your physical form. You have seen what an illithid can do.

AvD_ROM_48.text: Imagine - some of that could be in your grasp. Not enough to warp your appearance beyond recognition, but just enough to enhance your potential.

AvD_ROM_130.text: And believe me, it will radically increase our chances of success against the elder brain.

AvD_ROM_75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black implying player falling asleep.

AvD_ROM_88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black implying player falling asleep.

AvD_ROM_39.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_39.text: You should reconsider your attachment to your physical form. You have seen what an illithid can do. You have experienced the pleasure for yourself.

AvD_ROM_171.text: It would make us even more compatible.

AvD_ROM_138.text: As well as radically increasing our chances of success against the elder brain.

AvD_ROM_216.text: We must stop it while we still can. Before we, too, become its slaves.
AvD_ROM_216.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black implying player falling asleep.

AvD_ROM_132.speaker: Narrator
AvD_ROM_132.text: *As you drift into sleep, you feel a certain disappointment. The mind flayer was very quick to abandon its attentions on you.*
AvD_ROM_132.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black implying player falling asleep.

AvD_ROM_8.text: We must stop it while we still can. Before we, too, become its slaves.
AvD_ROM_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black implying player falling asleep.

AvD_ROM_175.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_175.text: I prefer this one. Just... show me what to do.

AvD_ROM_119.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_119.text: Try to find its mouth so you can kiss it.

AvD_ROM_113.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts their hand and reaches out to part the mind flayer's tentacles. The mind flayer raises its own hand to stop you.

AvD_ROM_157.text: I'm sorry - you're right - now's not the time. Forget I said anything.

AvD_ROM_77.text: Let's move on to more important things.

AvD_ROM_2.text: Is it? We have experienced much together. Consider this an opportunity for further mutual exploration.

AvD_ROM_43.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_43.text: I'd rather we stick to business.

AvD_ROM_205.text: Freak? If only you knew... but why conceal it? You may as well see for yourself.
AvD_ROM_205.context: CinematicNodeContext: snap his hand to cast the vision

AvD_ROM_65.context:
CinematicNodeContext: We see Stelmane lying in a coma in her bed. Shot of her eyes moving left and right under the lids, a struggle painted all over her face. 

Background becomes black - we see the Emperor standing over her bed in the same scene, dominating her mind with psychic energy. 

Shot of Stelmane's eyes blinking open, possessed.

AvD_ROM_176.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Moving still: Stelmane and a merchant in conversation. Through a gap in the door behind them, the mind flayer’s eyes glow. Shot of merchan'ts unease. Shot of Stelmane's face - eyes rolled back like Orpheus', clearly possessed. 

NB this is the same as the scene in INT_EmperorRevealed_AfterOrpheus but with the added reveal of Stelmane's possession.

AvD_ROM_44.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Moving still: Stelmane and Emperor toasting one another in her office. 

The Emperor pulls out the chair for her. She sits. Shot of her in her big chair with her eyes rolled to the whites, completely posssessed. 

NB this is the same as the scene in INT_EmperorRevealed_AfterOrpheus but with the added reveal of Stelmane's possession.

AvD_ROM_10.text: Did you like it - the truth? This was the alternative relationship we could have had. Aren't you glad I finessed my methods?

AvD_ROM_95.text: But since you insist on thwarting my craft, let us be blunt.

AvD_ROM_92.text: You are my puppet. Make no mistake. Without me, you have no value.

AvD_ROM_31.text: You will take me to the brain because you have no other choice. And once we are there, you will do exactly what I tell you to.

AvD_ROM_14.text: And you would do well to reconsider unlocking your potential. Your puerile attachment to your material form jeopardises us all. If I must, I will force you.

AvD_ROM_58.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_58.text: You're right. For now, we have to be allies.

AvD_ROM_192.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_192.text: Finally the mask drops. And you put so much effort into it.

AvD_ROM_55.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_55.text: First chance I get I will rip your head off, mind flayer.

AvD_ROM_189.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_189.text: I should have thrown you and the Prism to the shadow curse.

AvD_ROM_120.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_120.text: I think you misread the signs - I'm fine with what we have now.

AvD_ROM_81.text: I'm sorry - you're right - now's not the time. Forget I said anything.

AvD_ROM_86.text: Let's move on to more important things.

AvD_ROM_199.speaker: Player
AvD_ROM_199.text: You could have been open with me from the start.

AvD_ROM_225.text: Perhaps, but I couldn't take the risk. An elder brain leaves no room for error.

AvD_ROM_71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor turns to face us, player sits up.
